intro: Antillanthus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban antillanthus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in shaded, moist environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
